tool_description: Historical tornado data from 1950 to 2021 provides a comprehensive record of one of the most powerful and destructive forces of nature. Tornadoes are violent windstorms characterized by their rapidly rotating columns of air, often extending from the base of thunderstorms to the ground. The data collected over this extensive time span offers valuable insights into tornado patterns, trends, and the impact of these natural disasters on communities and the environment.
name: Tornado Data 2021
title: Tornado Data 2021

api_list.name: Tornado Injuries List
api_list.description: 67558 tornadoes sorted by injuries. Pagination available

api_list.name: Tornado Fatalities List
api_list.description: 67558 tornadoes sorted by fatalities. Pagination available

api_list.name: Tornadoes By State
api_list.description: Get a list of tornadoes based on the state code. Pagination available

api_list.name: EF2 Tornado List
api_list.description: Get stats on tornadoes with a magnitude of 2. Pagination available

api_list.name: EF1 Tornado List
api_list.description: Get stats on tornadoes with a magnitude of 1. Pagination available

api_list.name: EF3 Tornado List
api_list.description: Get stats on EF3 Tornadoes . Pagination Available

api_list.name: EF4 Tornado List
api_list.description: Get stats on all EF4 Tornadoes. Pagination Available

api_list.name: EF5 Tornado List
api_list.description: Get stats on all tornadoes with a magnitude of 5. Pagination available

api_list.name: Ten Highest Injuries
api_list.description: Get stats on the ten tornadoes with the highest injuries
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tornado-data-2021.p.rapidapi.com/weather/tornadoes/1950-2021/highest-ten-injuries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tornado-data-2021.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
